nfc-emulate-forum-tag4.c

00041 /*
00042  * This implementation was written based on information provided by the
00043  * following documents:
00044  *
00045  * NFC Forum Type 4 Tag Operation
00046  *  Technical Specification
00047  *  NFCForum-TS-Type-4-Tag_1.0 - 2007-03-13
00048  *  NFCForum-TS-Type-4-Tag_2.0 - 2010-11-18
00049  */
00050 
00051 // Notes & differences with nfc-emulate-tag:
00052 // - This example only works with PN532 because it relies on
00053 //   its internal handling of ISO14443-4 specificities.
00054 // - Thanks to this internal handling & injection of WTX frames,
00055 //   this example works on readers very strict on timing
00056 
00057 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00058 #  include "config.h"
00059 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H
00060 
00061 #include <sys/types.h>
00062 #include <sys/stat.h>
00063 
00064 #include <errno.h>
00065 #include <signal.h>
00066 #include <stdio.h>
00067 #include <stdlib.h>
00068 #include <stddef.h>
00069 #include <stdint.h>
00070 #include <string.h>
00071 
00072 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00073 #include <nfc/nfc-emulation.h>
00074 
00075 #include "nfc-utils.h"
00076 
00077 static nfc_device *pnd;
00078 static nfc_context *context;
00079 static bool quiet_output = false;
00080 // Version of the emulated type4 tag:
00081 static int type4v = 2;
00082 
00083 #define SYMBOL_PARAM_fISO14443_4_PICC   0x20
00084 
00085 typedef enum { NONE, CC_FILE, NDEF_FILE } file;
00086 
00087 struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data {
00088   uint8_t *ndef_file;
00089   size_t   ndef_file_len;
00090 };
00091 
00092 struct nfcforum_tag4_state_machine_data {
00093   file     current_file;
00094 };
00095 
00096 uint8_t nfcforum_capability_container[] = {
00097   0x00, 0x0F, /* CCLEN 15 bytes */
00098   0x20,       /* Mapping version 2.0, use option -1 to force v1.0 */
00099   0x00, 0x54, /* MLe Maximum R-ADPU data size */
00100 // Notes:
00101 //  - I (Romuald) don't know why Nokia 6212 Classic refuses the NDEF message if MLe is more than 0xFD (any suggests are welcome);
00102 //  - ARYGON devices doesn't support extended frame sending, consequently these devices can't sent more than 0xFE bytes as APDU, so 0xFB APDU data bytes.
00103 //  - I (Romuald) don't know why ARYGON device doesn't ACK when MLe > 0x54 (ARYGON frame length = 0xC2 (192 bytes))
00104   0x00, 0xFF, /* MLc Maximum C-ADPU data size */
00105   0x04,       /* T field of the NDEF File-Control TLV */
00106   0x06,       /* L field of the NDEF File-Control TLV */
00107   /* V field of the NDEF File-Control TLV */
00108   0xE1, 0x04, /* File identifier */
00109   0xFF, 0xFE, /* Maximum NDEF Size */
00110   0x00,       /* NDEF file read access condition */
00111   0x00,       /* NDEF file write access condition */
00112 };
00113 
00114 /* C-ADPU offsets */
00115 #define CLA  0
00116 #define INS  1
00117 #define P1   2
00118 #define P2   3
00119 #define LC   4
00120 #define DATA 5
00121 
00122 #define ISO144434A_RATS 0xE0
00123 
00124 static int
00125 nfcforum_tag4_io(struct nfc_emulator *emulator, const uint8_t *data_in, const size_t data_in_len, uint8_t *data_out, const size_t data_out_len)
00126 {
00127   int res = 0;
00128 
00129   struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data *ndef_data = (struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data *)(emulator->user_data);
00130   struct nfcforum_tag4_state_machine_data *state_machine_data = (struct nfcforum_tag4_state_machine_data *)(emulator->state_machine->data);
00131 
00132   if (data_in_len == 0) {
00133     // No input data, nothing to do
00134     return res;
00135   }
00136 
00137   // Show transmitted command
00138   if (!quiet_output) {
00139     printf("    In: ");
00140     print_hex(data_in, data_in_len);
00141   }
00142 
00143   if (data_in_len >= 4) {
00144     if (data_in[CLA] != 0x00)
00145       return -ENOTSUP;
00146 
00147 #define ISO7816_SELECT         0xA4
00148 #define ISO7816_READ_BINARY    0xB0
00149 #define ISO7816_UPDATE_BINARY  0xD6
00150 
00151     switch (data_in[INS]) {
00152       case ISO7816_SELECT:
00153 
00154         switch (data_in[P1]) {
00155           case 0x00: /* Select by ID */
00156             if ((data_in[P2] | 0x0C) != 0x0C)
00157               return -ENOTSUP;
00158 
00159             const uint8_t ndef_capability_container[] = { 0xE1, 0x03 };
00160             const uint8_t ndef_file[] = { 0xE1, 0x04 };
00161             if ((data_in[LC] == sizeof(ndef_capability_container)) && (0 == memcmp(ndef_capability_container, data_in + DATA, data_in[LC]))) {
00162               memcpy(data_out, "\x90\x00", res = 2);
00163               state_machine_data->current_file = CC_FILE;
00164             } else if ((data_in[LC] == sizeof(ndef_file)) && (0 == memcmp(ndef_file, data_in + DATA, data_in[LC]))) {
00165               memcpy(data_out, "\x90\x00", res = 2);
00166               state_machine_data->current_file = NDEF_FILE;
00167             } else {
00168               memcpy(data_out, "\x6a\x00", res = 2);
00169               state_machine_data->current_file = NONE;
00170             }
00171 
00172             break;
00173           case 0x04: /* Select by name */
00174             if (data_in[P2] != 0x00)
00175               return -ENOTSUP;
00176 
00177             const uint8_t ndef_tag_application_name_v1[] = { 0xD2, 0x76, 0x00, 0x00, 0x85, 0x01, 0x00 };
00178             const uint8_t ndef_tag_application_name_v2[] = { 0xD2, 0x76, 0x00, 0x00, 0x85, 0x01, 0x01 };
00179             if ((type4v == 1) && (data_in[LC] == sizeof(ndef_tag_application_name_v1)) && (0 == memcmp(ndef_tag_application_name_v1, data_in + DATA, data_in[LC])))
00180               memcpy(data_out, "\x90\x00", res = 2);
00181             else if ((type4v == 2) && (data_in[LC] == sizeof(ndef_tag_application_name_v2)) && (0 == memcmp(ndef_tag_application_name_v2, data_in + DATA, data_in[LC])))
00182               memcpy(data_out, "\x90\x00", res = 2);
00183             else
00184               memcpy(data_out, "\x6a\x82", res = 2);
00185 
00186             break;
00187           default:
00188             return -ENOTSUP;
00189         }
00190 
00191         break;
00192       case ISO7816_READ_BINARY:
00193         if ((size_t)(data_in[LC] + 2) > data_out_len) {
00194           return -ENOSPC;
00195         }
00196         switch (state_machine_data->current_file) {
00197           case NONE:
00198             memcpy(data_out, "\x6a\x82", res = 2);
00199             break;
00200           case CC_FILE:
00201             memcpy(data_out, nfcforum_capability_container + (data_in[P1] << 8) + data_in[P2], data_in[LC]);
00202             memcpy(data_out + data_in[LC], "\x90\x00", 2);
00203             res = data_in[LC] + 2;
00204             break;
00205           case NDEF_FILE:
00206             memcpy(data_out, ndef_data->ndef_file + (data_in[P1] << 8) + data_in[P2], data_in[LC]);
00207             memcpy(data_out + data_in[LC], "\x90\x00", 2);
00208             res = data_in[LC] + 2;
00209             break;
00210         }
00211         break;
00212 
00213       case ISO7816_UPDATE_BINARY:
00214         memcpy(ndef_data->ndef_file + (data_in[P1] << 8) + data_in[P2], data_in + DATA, data_in[LC]);
00215         if ((data_in[P1] << 8) + data_in[P2] == 0) {
00216           ndef_data->ndef_file_len = (ndef_data->ndef_file[0] << 8) + ndef_data->ndef_file[1] + 2;
00217         }
00218         memcpy(data_out, "\x90\x00", res = 2);
00219         break;
00220       default: // Unknown
00221         if (!quiet_output) {
00222           printf("Unknown frame, emulated target abort.\n");
00223         }
00224         res = -ENOTSUP;
00225     }
00226   } else {
00227     res = -ENOTSUP;
00228   }
00229 
00230   // Show transmitted command
00231   if (!quiet_output) {
00232     if (res < 0) {
00233       ERR("%s (%d)", strerror(-res), -res);
00234     } else {
00235       printf("    Out: ");
00236       print_hex(data_out, res);
00237     }
00238   }
00239   return res;
00240 }
00241 
00242 static void stop_emulation(int sig)
00243 {
00244   (void) sig;
00245   if (pnd != NULL) {
00246     nfc_abort_command(pnd);
00247   } else {
00248     nfc_exit(context);
00249     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00250   }
00251 }
00252 
00253 static int
00254 ndef_message_load(char *filename, struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data *tag_data)
00255 {
00256   struct stat sb;
00257   if (stat(filename, &sb) < 0) {
00258     printf("file not found or not accessible '%s'", filename);
00259     return -1;
00260   }
00261 
00262   /* Check file size */
00263   if (sb.st_size > 0xFFFF) {
00264     printf("file size too large '%s'", filename);
00265     return -1;
00266   }
00267 
00268   tag_data->ndef_file_len = sb.st_size + 2;
00269 
00270   tag_data->ndef_file[0] = (uint8_t)(sb.st_size >> 8);
00271   tag_data->ndef_file[1] = (uint8_t)(sb.st_size);
00272 
00273   FILE *F;
00274   if (!(F = fopen(filename, "r"))) {
00275     printf("fopen (%s, \"r\")", filename);
00276     return -1;
00277   }
00278 
00279   if (1 != fread(tag_data->ndef_file + 2, sb.st_size, 1, F)) {
00280     printf("Can't read from %s", filename);
00281     fclose(F);
00282     return -1;
00283   }
00284 
00285   fclose(F);
00286   return sb.st_size;
00287 }
00288 
00289 static int
00290 ndef_message_save(char *filename, struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data *tag_data)
00291 {
00292   FILE *F;
00293   if (!(F = fopen(filename, "w"))) {
00294     printf("fopen (%s, w)", filename);
00295     return -1;
00296   }
00297 
00298   if (1 != fwrite(tag_data->ndef_file + 2, tag_data->ndef_file_len - 2, 1, F)) {
00299     printf("fwrite (%d)", (int) tag_data->ndef_file_len - 2);
00300     fclose(F);
00301     return -1;
00302   }
00303 
00304   fclose(F);
00305   return tag_data->ndef_file_len - 2;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static void
00309 usage(char *progname)
00310 {
00311   fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [-1] [infile [outfile]]\n", progname);
00312   fprintf(stderr, "      -1: force Tag Type 4 v1.0 (default is v2.0)\n");
00313 }
00314 
00315 int
00316 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00317 {
00318   int options = 0;
00319   nfc_target nt = {
00320     .nm = {
00321       .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00322       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED, // Will be updated by nfc_target_init()
00323     },
00324     .nti = {
00325       .nai = {
00326         .abtAtqa = { 0x00, 0x04 },
00327         .abtUid = { 0x08, 0x00, 0xb0, 0x0b },
00328         .szUidLen = 4,
00329         .btSak = 0x20,
00330         .abtAts = { 0x75, 0x33, 0x92, 0x03 }, /* Not used by PN532 */
00331         .szAtsLen = 4,
00332       },
00333     },
00334   };
00335 
00336   uint8_t ndef_file[0xfffe] = {
00337     0x00, 33,
00338     0xd1, 0x02, 0x1c, 0x53, 0x70, 0x91, 0x01, 0x09, 0x54, 0x02,
00339     0x65, 0x6e, 0x4c, 0x69, 0x62, 0x6e, 0x66, 0x63, 0x51, 0x01,
00340     0x0b, 0x55, 0x03, 0x6c, 0x69, 0x62, 0x6e, 0x66, 0x63, 0x2e,
00341     0x6f, 0x72, 0x67
00342   };
00343 
00344   struct nfcforum_tag4_ndef_data nfcforum_tag4_data = {
00345     .ndef_file = ndef_file,
00346     .ndef_file_len = ndef_file[1] + 2,
00347   };
00348 
00349   struct nfcforum_tag4_state_machine_data state_machine_data = {
00350     .current_file = NONE,
00351   };
00352 
00353   struct nfc_emulation_state_machine state_machine = {
00354     .io   = nfcforum_tag4_io,
00355     .data = &state_machine_data,
00356   };
00357 
00358   struct nfc_emulator emulator = {
00359     .target = &nt,
00360     .state_machine = &state_machine,
00361     .user_data = &nfcforum_tag4_data,
00362   };
00363 
00364   if ((argc > (1 + options)) && (0 == strcmp("-h", argv[1 + options]))) {
00365     usage(argv[0]);
00366     exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00367   }
00368 
00369   if ((argc > (1 + options)) && (0 == strcmp("-1", argv[1 + options]))) {
00370     type4v = 1;
00371     nfcforum_capability_container[2] = 0x10;
00372     options += 1;
00373   }
00374 
00375   if (argc > (3 + options)) {
00376     usage(argv[0]);
00377     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00378   }
00379 
00380   // If some file is provided load it
00381   if (argc >= (2 + options)) {
00382     if (ndef_message_load(argv[1 + options], &nfcforum_tag4_data) < 0) {
00383       printf("Can't load NDEF file '%s'", argv[1 + options]);
00384       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00385     }
00386   }
00387 
00388   nfc_init(&context);
00389   if (context == NULL) {
00390     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)\n");
00391     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00392   }
00393 
00394   // Try to open the NFC reader
00395   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00396 
00397   if (pnd == NULL) {
00398     ERR("Unable to open NFC device");
00399     nfc_exit(context);
00400     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00401   }
00402 
00403   signal(SIGINT, stop_emulation);
00404 
00405   printf("NFC device: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00406   printf("Emulating NDEF tag now, please touch it with a second NFC device\n");
00407 
00408   if (0 != nfc_emulate_target(pnd, &emulator, 0)) {  // contains already nfc_target_init() call
00409     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_emulate_target");
00410     nfc_close(pnd);
00411     nfc_exit(context);
00412     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00413   }
00414 
00415   if (argc == (3 + options)) {
00416     if (ndef_message_save(argv[2 + options], &nfcforum_tag4_data) < 0) {
00417       printf("Can't save NDEF file '%s'", argv[2 + options]);
00418       nfc_close(pnd);
00419       nfc_exit(context);
00420       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00421     }
00422   }
00423 
00424   nfc_close(pnd);
00425   nfc_exit(context);
00426   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00427 }
